parameters.description: Type of external payment information. If not specified, the default value is ENCRYPTED_CREDIT_CARD. This is used to filter the external payment information by type.

post.summary: Validate that you have provided the necessary information or user assessment to perform a transaction.

parameters.name: x-pti-client-id
parameters.description: Client ID provided to you during onboarding.

parameters.name: x-pti-request-id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the request. This ID must be provided and stored by the client of this API at the creation of a transaction. This ID is attached to all PTI internal operations as well as the webhook calls. This ID is required to post feedback about a transaction and get support from PTI for a problem on a transaction. Creating two transactions having the same requestId is not allowed.

parameters.name: x-pti-scenario-id
parameters.description: Represents a user action under which transaction amounts will accumulated and will control the User assessment requirements. The values this header can take must be agreed upon and communicated to PTI. Setting unknown values here will generate an error.

parameters.name: x-pti-session-id
parameters.description: Session ID associated to a UI session for a specific user. Should match the value passed to the PTI SDK at initialization.

parameters.name: x-pti-disable-webhook
parameters.description: Set to true to disable webhook calls for this request.

post.description: This endpoint is used to assess a user. Depending on what information is available on the user,  a tier level will be assigned to the assessment, the higher the level is, the more permission he will get on your platform.  Please refer to PTI documentation for more information on the tier levels configuration and scenarios.

422.description: One of these 2 cases: More information about the User is needed in order to approve the transaction. There is no approved assessment for this user that enables him to perform the operation.

200.description: Your server returns this code if it accepts the callback

post.description:
This endpoint allows adding feedback information to an existing transaction. Here are the possible feedback values with their meaning:

| Feedback | Meaning |
|----------|---------|
| `ACCEPTED` | The transaction was accepted by the processor and is deemed to be in a pending state. This feedback is not a final state and should be followed by antoher feedback such as `SETTLED` or `CANCELLED` |
| `SETTLED`  | The transaction was accepted and fully finalized by the processor. The transfer of value has occured. |
| `CANCELLED`  | The transaction was accepted but cancelled prior to being settled |
| `AWAITING_PAYMENT` | A deposit transaction is being processed and is in a state where it is waiting for the user to complete the payment by funding the target address provided or making a deposit using the specified payment method. |
| `REJECTED` | The transaction was declined by the processor |
| `REFUNDED` | An intentional, settled transaction was refunded |
| `CHARGED_BACK` | A settled transaction was disputed and refunded |
| `ERROR` | The processor returned an error, the transaction is assumed to be non existent from the processor standpoint |

parameters.name: x-pti-client-id
parameters.description: Client ID provided to you during onboarding.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: Request ID used when the transaction was initially logged

requestBody.description: Feedback to associate to the existing transaction

201.description: Successfully added transaction feedback. Returns the requestId in the id value of the response.

400.description: Missing required fields on transaction feedback

404.description: Transaction identified by requestId not found

bankAccountNumber.description: Valid bank account number, Required for ACH and WIRE

bankAccountType.description: Type of bank account, Required for ACH and WIRE

bankSwiftCode.description: Valid bank swift code, Required for International WIRE

bankRoutingNumber.description: Valid bank routing number, between 7 and 12 digits, Required for ACH and WIRE

bankRoutingCheckDigit.description: Valid bank routing check digit, 1 digit, Required for ACH and WIRE

accountBankName.description: Name of the bank of the account, Required for OUTGOING WIRE transactions, persisted as part of the payment information

creationDate.description: ISO 8601 formatted creation date of the business

coutryOfIncorporation.description: ISO 3166 alpha 1 country code, example US

countryCode.description: ISO 3166 alpha 1 country code, example US

creditCardReference.description: Reference to the credit card in our system, this must be set when you create a credit card

meta.description: key/value map of extra meta data for this credit card

errors: Invalid field: 'amount' must be greater than or equal to 0

code.description:
# Error codes descriptions
NO_ERROR(0)
INVALID_REQUEST(1000)
MIN_INFO_MISSING(1001)
MIN_ASSESSMENT_MISSING(1002)
ALREADY_IN_PROGRESS(1003)
MISSING_WALLET(1004)
WALLETS_DIFFERENT_CURRENCY(1005)
WALLETS_SAME_CURRENCY(1006)
SOURCE_WALLET_DESTINATION_TOKEN_ONLY(1007)
ITEM_USD_VALUE_REQUIRED_WHEN_MULTIPLE_ITEMS(1008)
INVALID_USER_TAG(1009)
MISSING_TRANSACTION_GROUP_ID(1010)
DIFFERENT_BUY_SELL_AMOUNT(1011)
DIFFERENT_BUY_SELL_CURRENCIES(1012)
NO_INTER_CLIENTS_TRANSFERS(2000)
CLIENT_CONFIGURATION_ERROR(2001)
UNSUPPORTED_OPERATION(2002)
COUNTRY_NOT_SUPPORTED(2003)
NOT_ENOUGH_FUNDS(3000)
INVALID_ASSET_OWNERSHIP(3001)
FEES_WALLET_NOT_FOUND(3002)
REVERT_ONLY_CHARGE_BACK(3003)
MISSING_CORRESPONDING_BUY_TRANSACTION(3004)
ALREADY_EXISTING_CORRESPONDING_TRANSACTION_PAIR(3005)
BUY_TRANSACTION_NOT_SETTLED(3006)
FIAT_ONLY(3007)
SOURCE_DESTINATION_WALLET(3008)
INVALID_SOURCE_CURRENCY(3009)
INVALID_DESTINATION_CURRENCY(3010)
USD_WALLET_ONLY(3011)
BANK_ONLY(4000)
MISSING_EMAIL_ADDRESS(4001)
MISSING_BANK_ACCOUNT_INFORMATION(4002)
MISSING_BANK_ACCOUNT_NUMBER_INFORMATION(4003)
MISSING_BANK_ACCOUNT_TYPE(4004)
MANDATORY_IP_ADDRESS(5000)
MANDATORY_EMAIL_ADDRESS(5001)
MISSING_CC_INFO(5002)
CC_ONLY(5003)
UNABLE_TO_PROVIDE_ESTIMATES(6000)
FUNDING_FROM_CRYPTO_ONLY(6001)
WITHDRAWAL_FROM_WALLET_TO_CRYPTO(6002)
SOURCE_WALLET_CURRENCY_DIFFERENT_THAN_DESTINATION_TOKEN_CURRENCY(6003)

transactionId.description: A transaction hash or any relevant identifier for the transaction

date.description: Timestamp when the transaction feedback changed. This will be used in transaction reports. If not provided, it will be set to the time at which the api call is made. The format must be compatible with the ISO-8601 standard. e.g. 2022-01-01T00:00:00

executeDepositTransaction.description: Fund a wallet with crypto. SourceMethod: external crypto wallet. DestinationMethod: wallet on the platform.

destinationClientId.description: Only used for transfers between two different clients. Must be configured before using.

executeTransferTransaction.description: Transfer between two users. SourceMethod: wallet on the platform. DestinationMethod: wallet on the platform. Destination: destination user.

digitalItems.description: One of digitalItem or digitalItems is required.

executeBuyTransaction.description: Buy digital item in the platform. SourceMethod: wallet, token, fiat. DigitalItem: NFT or OTHER.

digitalItem.itemTitle: LB, Mint Condition, #4/7 From Core 22 Set

digitalItems.description: One of digitalItem or digitalItems is required

executeSellTransaction.description: Sell digital item in the platform. DestinationMethod: wallet, fiat, token. DigitalItem: NFT, OTHER.

digitalItem.itemTitle: LB, Mint Condition, #4/7 From Core 22 Set

executeWithdrawalTransaction.description: Withdraw from a wallet to fiat destination. SourceMethod: wallet on the platform. DestinationMethod: fiat payment method.

executeTradeTransaction.description: Trade currency/crypto for another. SourceMethod: wallet. DestinationMethod: wallet.

executePaymentTransaction.description: Collect payment from the initiator, the beneficiary is the client platform's  specified wallet in the destinationMethod(if specified).

executeMintTransaction.description: Mint some value on behalf of a user in a wallet. DestinationMethod: wallet on the platform. destination: destination user.

clientMeta.description: key/value map of extra meta data for this kyc

id.description: Unique identifier for the payment information, must be used to refer to a payment information for a payment

countryOfCitizenship.description: Comma separated list of ISO 3166 alpha 1 country codes

number.description: Phone number, can be formatted using plus sign, spaces, parenthesis or hyphens

currency.description: Token symbol that your user is trading

network.description: Blockchain network name, example ethereum, bitcoin, solana

privateBlockchain.description: If blockchain is a private chain

clientMeta.description: key/value map of extra meta data for this payment info, for example, it could be useful to add information to a transaction, like if a subtoken asset is involved

cryptoPaymentMethodDestination.description: The destination payment method of the trade(wallet), if available

cryptoPaymentMethodSource.description: The source payment method of the trade(wallet), if available

ptiMeta.description: key/value map of extra meta data for this request (used by PTI)

clientMeta.description: key/value map of extra meta data for this request (used by Client)

transaction.description: The `transactionTotal` field will be assumed to be all zeroes if not provided. If no currency has been provided `USD` will be used. If no amount has been provided `0` will be used

destinationClientId.description: Used only for transfers between two different clients. Must be configured before using.

paymentTransaction.description: Payment transaction, often this is not initiated by a user itself The destination can be specified, and needs to belong to the root user.

mintTransaction.description: The action of minting, often this is not initiated by a user itself, so the initiator property is optional. The destination is the beneficiary of the minting action. You can specify the target wallet in the destination method if available.

tradeTransaction.description: The action of doing a token trade. Source and destination wallet are provided through the source and destination methods properties.

userStatusReason.description: Reason explaining why the status is BLOCKED or INACTIVE. Same rules as the `status` field apply.

userStatus.description: Status of the user. Only ACTIVE users can appear in API calls.  Calls containing INACTIVE or BLOCKED users will result in an error.  The status cannot be set via API calls that create or update users.  If it is passed in user creation or modification calls, it will be silently ignored.

id.description: Unique identifier for this user. This value MUST be chosen and stored at user creation time.

tags.description: Tag that characterizes the user. Used for internal classification purposes.

userCreationDate.description: Optional ISO-8601 value. Used to provide the date the user was created in your system. If left empty, it will be populated at current time.

userPtiMeta.description: key/value map of extra meta data for this request (used by PTI)

userClientMeta.description: key/value map of extra meta data for this request (used by Client)

userType.description: Type of user which represents the legal entity involved in the API action

depositInstruction.description: External reference to the wallet(could be bank account number, or blockchain address)

intendedTransactionUsdValue.description: The value of the transaction that the user is intending to perform in USD

ptiMeta.description: key/value map of extra meta data for this request (used by PTI)

clientMeta.description: key/value map of extra meta data for this request (used by Client)

uuidLikeStrSubClient.description: If your system is multi-tenant and you have this is the id of your client that is making the request

uuidLikeStrTransactionGroup.description: If your system performs transactions that are together part of an overall transaction group, use this to tie them together

feeRecipientId.description: User ID of the Commission Recipient

itemReference.description: Reference information about the item, for example could be the contract address of an NFT item.

itemTitle.description: The name of the item, for example: ShaggyDog#2

itemDescription.description: Description about the item, for example: Shaggy Dog Collection is an NFT for Dog lovers. It is a manually generated NFT created on the Ethereum network.

itemUSDValue.description: Mandatory when more than one item is provided in the payload. The cost of the item being paid by the user, or the estimated value of the item in question.

example.itemDescription: Shaggy Dog Collection is an NFT for Dog lovers. It is a manually generated NFT created on the Ethereum network.

transactionStatusObject.description: Status of a transaction request. The date property is the date that the transaction has been initiated.

userStatusObject.description: Update in the status of a user. You will receive this when the user status changes from the value initially recorded in the system.

transactionAssessStatusObject.description: Status of a transaction assessment request. The date property is the date that the reported transaction occurred.

transactionQuoteStatusObject.description: Status of a transaction quote request. The date property is the date that the quote request has been initiated.

userAssessStatusObject.description: Status of a user assessment request. The date property is the date that the assessment has been initiated.

mandatoryScenarioIdHeaderParam.name: x-pti-scenario-id
mandatoryScenarioIdHeaderParam.description: Represents a user action under which transaction amounts will accumulated and will control the User assessment requirements. The values this header can take must be agreed upon and communicated to PTI. Setting unknown values here will generate an error.

disableWebhookHeaderParam.name: x-pti-disable-webhook
disableWebhookHeaderParam.description: Set to true to disable webhook calls for this request.

providerNameHeaderParam.name: x-pti-provider-name
providerNameHeaderParam.description: Used to specify which provider is responsible for handling the given operation. Ignored if the client configuration is not set for passive mode.

requestIdHeaderParam.name: x-pti-request-id
requestIdHeaderParam.description: Unique identifier of the request. This ID must be provided and stored by the client of this API at the creation of a transaction. This ID is attached to all PTI internal operations as well as the webhook calls. This ID is required to post feedback about a transaction and get support from PTI for a problem on a transaction. Creating two transactions having the same requestId is not allowed.

sessionIdHeaderParam.name: x-pti-session-id
sessionIdHeaderParam.description: Session ID associated to a UI session for a specific user. Should match the value passed to the PTI SDK at initialization.

pageSizeParam.name: size
pageSizeParam.description: Page size for pagination. If not specified, the default value is 20.

externalPaymentInformationTypeParam.name: type
externalPaymentInformationTypeParam.description: Type of external payment information. If not specified, the default value is ENCRYPTED_CREDIT_CARD. This is used to filter the external payment information by type.

offsetParam.name: page
offsetParam.description: Offset for pagination. If not specified, the default value is 0.

sortByParam.name: sortBy
sortByParam.description: Sort by field. If not specified, the default value is creation date.

clientIdHeaderParam.name: x-pti-client-id
clientIdHeaderParam.description: Client ID provided to you during onboarding.

signature.description: Client signature for a specific request. Header x-pti-signature

userToken.description: Single use token generated for a specific request(JWT Format). Header x-pti-token
